meanings.definition: Grandaddies: plural noun, informal term for grandfathers
meanings.sent1: My grandaddies always tell the best stories about the old days.
meanings.sent2: I visited my grandaddies over the weekend and helped them in the garden.
meanings.sent3: When my grandaddies start arguing about who is the best cook, it's always entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The wisdom of my grandaddies is a treasure trove of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The image of my grandaddies sitting on the porch, chatting away, is etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: Grandaddies: plural noun, large or impressive examples of something
meanings.sent1: The sequoia trees in the forest are the grandaddies of all trees.
meanings.sent2: The grandaddies of all sandwiches at the deli is the foot-long sub.
meanings.sent3: The grandaddies of all snowflakes fell gently from the sky, covering the town in white.
meanings.sent4: The grandaddies of all mountains stood majestically against the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The grandaddies of all fireworks lit up the night sky in a spectacular display.

meanings.definition: Grandaddies: plural noun, the oldest or most influential members of a group
meanings.sent1: In the world of music, The Beatles are considered the grandaddies of rock and roll.
meanings.sent2: The grandaddies of the chess club always have the best strategies.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, the grandaddies of the clan shared stories of their youth.
meanings.sent4: The grandaddies of the business world paved the way for future entrepreneurs.
meanings.sent5: The grandaddies of the forest, the ancient oaks, stood tall and proud.
